description.narrative: 1. Individual LGBTI know and accept their SOGIESC and can ensure their rights in society are respected. They can meaningfully engage with societal structures. 2. A support system for LGBTI is developed based on discussions about common issues, needs, and challenges, creating the motivation to act against discrimination and marginalization. 3. LGBTI CBOs can strategically engage in societal and political decision-making processes using evidence-based advocacy. 4. Agile LGBTI movements are built that can work collectively to create social and political change and respond flexibly to various situations. 5. Institutions and other allies have an internal drive to include LGBTI in their decision-making and other structures. LGBTI are actively engaged in processes and all policy-making spaces. 6. Strong and reliable laws and policies are in place for LGBTI and are enforced by all relevant bodies. Follow-up on these policies and their implementation are under scrutiny
Working towards diverse and inclusive societies in the MENA region, in which LGBTI are able to participate to their full potential

recipient-region.narrative: This includes some countries in the MENA region

title.narrative: Access and Escalation in leading up to influencing laws and policies

description.narrative: Access to regional/national/ global policy spaces is created to influence policy and facilitate escalation

title.narrative: Number of actions undertaken to positively influence civic space in the direction of less restrictive operational space, ability to perform functions and receive

description.narrative: This indicator accounts for the different actions grassroots organisations, CBOs and CSOs take to engage with governments, local authorities and other power holders to improve the civic space within which they operate. This includes actions such as attempts at NGO registeration, campaigning against restrictive policies, government monitoring etc.

comment.narrative: Due to the sensitivity of the work done in the program, country specific information cannot be provided as this can point at specific countries within the program
Within the program we expect to influence the public sector, NGOs, thought leaders and citizens.

Please refer to the annual report of the program for information on the type of actions undertaken to arrive at better NGO or labour/trade union legislation or agree on new codes of conduct and how it increases civil society space.

description.narrative: Agile LGBTI movements work collectively to create social and political change and to respond flexibly to various situations

description.narrative: This indicator accounts for the different grassroots organisations, CBOs and CSOs working together within the movement, but also across the movement

comment.narrative: The organization is fulfullling an indirect voice representational role
Partners will like to further improve their advocacy strategy and ability to formulate advocacy messages
The actuals are a good start for the program considering the sensitivity of the topics and the difficulty setting up the program while starting at the same time.

description.narrative: CBOs have a mandate with clear accountability and transparency mechanisms and can legitimately represent their community

title.narrative: Awareness and Acceptance raising in LGBTI individuals

description.narrative: Individual LGBTI break out of their isolation through information sharing and sensitisation

title.narrative: Number of actions undertaken to raise awareness and acceptance within LGBTI communities

description.narrative: This indicatior measures actions undertaken by grassroots organisations, CBOs and CSOs to reach out to LGBTI individuals and communities for the following purposes: provision of information on SOGIESC, human rights of LGBTI people, legal rights within national and regional frameworks, building self-esteem and integrating acceptance within LGBTI individuals and communities and enabling LGBTI individuals to engage with societal structures meaningfully.

description.narrative: This indicator measures the number of actions taken to inform, educate and/or engage different actors in society who have the ability to influence or change societal/legal norms/policies.
